etymologies: late 19th century: from limp(with reference to the bird's limping gait) + -kin

definitions: a wading marsh bird related to the rails, with long legs and a long bill, found in the southeastern US and tropical America.

notes.text: Aramus guarauna, the only member of the family Aramidae

shortDefinitions: wading marshbird related to rails, with long legs and long bill
